idea-plugin.name: Cyberpunk Theme
idea-plugin.description:
A theme inspired by the UI colors in Cyberpunk 2077.

To match the font in the plugin's screenshots:
  • Preferences > Editor > Font > Font: Source Code Pro (downloadable here)
  • Preferences > Appearance & Behavior > Appearance > Antialiasing > IDE: Greyscale
  • Preferences > Appearance & Behavior > Appearance > Antialiasing > Editor: Greyscale

To report a bug or make a suggestion, open an issue on GitHub.

This theme is open source under the MIT license.
idea-plugin.change-notes:
1.1.2
  • This change makes it so that selected files in the file browser will still show as selected (they will have a light grey background color) even when the file browser panel is not focused. This also applies to any other tree views other than the file browser. See here for more details: https://github.com/elliotwaite/jetbrains-cyberpunk-theme/pull/6.
1.1.1
  • The default code style for Rust adds an underline to mutable variable. This update changes the color of that underline from its default light pink color to a gray.
1.1.0
  • In this update, most of the background colors have been shifted slightly darker and other changes were made to make it compatible with JetBrain's new UI. Going forward, this theme will be mainly tested using the new UI, but it should still work well with the legacy UI (non-new UI). If you notice anything that looks off when using the legacy UI, please let me know on GitHub.
1.0.12
  • Updated the context menu's background color to be a slightly darker grey.
  • Changed the context menu selected item's background color from blue to a grey that is slightly lighter than the background.
  • The following elements were using non-theme grey colors, so they were slightly adjusted to use grey colors from the theme's palette: ERROR_HINT, INFORMATION_HINT, LOOKUP_COLOR, CODE_LENS_BORDER_COLOR
1.0.11
  • Changed the TODO stripe mark color from red to dark grey. This stripe mark is shown in the right scrollbar to identify TODO comments. The dark grey color better reflects that it's a TODO comment and not an error.
1.0.10
  • Changed class name color from white to green.
  • Changed interface name color from white to green.
  • Changed JavaScript global variable color from white to orange.
  • Changed TypeScript narrowed type background color from grey to none.
1.0.9
  • Updated button colors.
  • Updated welcome screen background colors.
  • Updated mnemonic bookmark button colors.
  • Several syntax color updates.
1.0.8
  • Updated the syntax colors for web related files (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.).
1.0.7
  • Fixed the "List > selectionInactiveBackground" color.
1.0.6
  • Expanded the compatibility range to include all current and future EAP versions.
1.0.5
  • Updated the colors for user-defined file types.
1.0.4
  • Updated the PHP syntax colors.
1.0.3
  • Updated the plugin icon.
